page.title: 06 Medley Sailing Club, Oxford
page.content: The club is for people of all ages who sail dingies (small sailing boats) as a pastime or a sport.The most common dingies are Mirrors,Toppers and Enterprises. The club is situated by the river Isis with a quay and a ramp just in front.It has a boatshed and club house,both wooden constructions,and a fenced yard for keeping boats in.The club owns a safety launch.There is also a shop inside which sells crisps and soft drinks,and a grassed area with climbing frame and swings. Every Sunday,except in winter,there are races organised by an officer of the day(O.D.). When a friend gave me a Mirror,I joined as a junior member.Every weekend I go down and do up my boat:painting,sanding and varnishing.
